text: Poured am oranges peach skin color with aromas of apricots, light dry wheat, and some light funk. Flavors are tart dried apricots, light sweetness and a dry apricot finish, solod, enjoyable, funk solod stuff.
Dry but sweet, with lots of apricot on the nose and in the profile. Lightly bitter and good acidity.
Bottle. Hazy orange pour with white head. Tart apricots, fruited, wine, oak sour aromas. Flavors are tart, apricot, fruited wine tones

[Jan 9 2016] Big bottle from Bethesda Food and Beverage. Nice orange body with big head. Nose is tart, sweet and funky. Tastes very fruity, and tart with hops too. Nice for the style. Malty notes too. Well done.
Bottle. Mild apricot bouquet. Dark yellow pour with a white head. Sour apricot notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Bright orange and hazy. Smells of nice apricot. Just a bit of vegetal grassy aroma. Light acidity. Has a nice apricot flavor as well. Still has that green flavor. Moderate sourness. Not quite the standard berliner profile. Medium light body. Nice flavor, except for the vegetal flavor.
Very nice. Cloudy orange pour with nearly no head. Aroma is sour and farmhouse like. Taste follows nose with a tart bite and some apricot sweetness. Liked it.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a hazy gold with a quickly fading off white head. Aroma of apricots and lemon. Flavors of plastic. A bit disappointing given the $20 bottle price.

From notes. Enjoyed this baby at a line share at Witchs Hat on St. Pattys Day. 750 mL bottle. No idea who poured it, but Abu came by to share it. Thanks man! The pour is a chunky and silty yellow orange color with a thin off white colored head that fades to a ring. The aroma is pretty good. There is a tart apricot juice right up front before it fades into a solid funk. There is a mustiness present, and a little citrus zest. The flavor is much of the same. Its really juicy and enjoyable. There is a solid juiciness to it, but the crisp tartness and enjoyable funkiness really bring this one together nicely. Basic and not overly complex, but well executed. The mouth feel is a little heavier and juicy, with a nice crisp carbonation and a lingeringly juicy, funky, tart apricot aftertaste. The more I get to drink these, the more I realize that I love peach and apricot anythings ha.

(750ml bottle, #2064) Pours a cloudy orange body with a small white head. Aroma of orange, vanilla, grass, yogurt, apricot, and lemon. Flavor of orange, lemon, tangerine, apricot, lemon, lacto, and lime.
Bottle..Poir is yellow with a white head..Nose is apricot pulp, spice, musty, juice...Taste is apricot, pulp, juice, clean, spice, herbal...

750 ml bottle to stemmed wine glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a very cloudy (juicy) apricot with ample eggshell head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; tart and mildly funky alongside a nice semi-sweet apricot presence. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly juice-like medium-bodied mouthfeel. Some mild wheat on the tongue as well. Good stuff.
Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a hazy orange with no head. The aroma is apricot, cheese, funk, dough. Thin mouth, tart apricot, funky, light acidity, very good.
750ml bottle pours a hazy yellow with a foamy white head. nice tart dry apricot and lemon taste. very refreshing beer

Banich! Thanks mang.

Bright orange, moderately hazy, small white head. Tart apricots, unicorns, rainbows. Incredibly drinkable and full flavored. Awesome sauce. If you see this, buy it.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters, displaying a cloudy, orangey color, with soft white head foam that quickly diminished to a light ring, no film, and light lacing. The nose was light yeastiness, soft wheat, and a combination of mimosa & stone fruit, with light tartness. Light to medium bodied, the taste was similar, with a bit more expression to the tartness, made available by the accompanying lively & spritzy carbonation. Sessionably refreshing.

On draught
Pours a hazy yellow with a small head that fades out fairly quickly.

The aroma is bright apricot with a nice mild yougurty twang. The aroma is pleasant & inviting, its very fruit forward without being especially sweet smelling. 

The flavor is bright, just all sorts of BRIGHT! Its got a bunch of apricot fruitiness, its very tart, its very dry. ITs got a load of lemon and citrus zest. Its got a pretty decent wallop of sourness without crossing any sort of unpleasant threshold. 

good stuff.

750 ml bottle sampled at Marks gigantic tasting alongside Fou Foune, which really was never a fair fight. Pours a hazy gold with no head. Very nice stone fruit characteristics, with apricot and peach, along with yogurt, sourdough, lactic funk, and cheesecloth. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a funky, tart, fruity mouthfeel. Really nice, understated apricot Berliner.

759 ml waxed bottle. Big wax. Pours hazy orange. Carbonation fades. Lots of apricots and tartness. Weiss is deceptive because there is much more going on there with the fruits and tartness. This is really tasty.
Draft at Meridian Pint. Cloudy to murky orange color. Stonefruit aroma. Taste is very lightly tart and earthy apricot.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Bottle. - Post Thanksgiving - Pours straw gold white head - nose/taste of apricot including sour apricot pit, lactose, oak, sour citrus, lemon, sour wheat and funky acid - medium body.

Bottle - fair size foamy head, dark straw color, nice mild sour apricot aroma and flavor, mildly sour finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at the Bottleworks, it poured a hazy orange amber colour with sudsy but short-lived white foam. Crisp, grainy, pleasantly acidic. Not merely tart but full-on sour, in a good way. True-to-style Berliner Weiss traits plus harmonious apricot. Light body, intense champagne-like carbonation with a similar metallic bite, lingering fruity, sparkling lemonade aftertaste. Extremely tasty, but I doubt Id ever pay $18+ for a bottle of session beer.

I hate sours... On draft at Harvest Cafe. Excellent color and aroma. Palate appealing and juicy. Saving a bottle for an August afternoon.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Cuginos. Lots of haze in this oranges gold beer. A nice fruity aroma includes those apricots. This is tart and very fruity. It tastes of apricots but more, too. Melons at the finish and citrus throughout. Yeast and just a little earth. A little funk. Tasty stuff.

On tap at the Tap Room. It poured a yellow/gold color with a small white head. The aroma was of funk, spices, wheat and some yogurt. The taste was similar to the aroma with more spices, yogurt, tartness, cheese, lemon peel and more funkiness. Very different, but tasty.

On tap at The Tap Room - Pours milky orange with a white head. The aroma has rich juicy apricots, very fruity and not really tart on the nose. Comes across like a fruit puree exclusively. It has a medium body with some heft and richness with tingly carbonation. The flavor starts with peppery spice, lots of apricots, citrus and wild yeast sourness. The finish gets more sour, but still has heavy fruit. The warmer it gets the more the sour takes over the fruit parts. Very good, but Im not sure its worth the ultra premium price tag on it. Guess they feel they are missing out on that trend going on now.
